DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare home support service patient COPD usual care . The study design evaluate impact interdisciplinary palliative care team community base self management advance COPD . A total thirty patient enrol study . Twenty patient randomly assign receive usual care , ten patient randomly assign usual care plus home support service . This study use objective criterion identify patient COPD likely benefit home base palliative care service . The patient undergo initial assessment medical , social work , spiritual care personnel follow family meeting establish care plan . Periodic schedule visit , need unscheduled visit address urgent need occur one year 's time attempt return patient COPD center decision make regard care , avoid acute exacerbation thereby avoid unscheduled clinic ER visit . Patients complete QOL survey symptom assessment scale upon initial intervention . After obtain information patient qualify study , participant randomize cohort . Those randomized serve case provide community base self management service interdisciplinary palliative care team . The control group receive standard care . At conclusion 12 month case control complete QOL survey , medical utilization , symptom assessment .
